abstract: G.M.’s U.S. sales were up 4 percent in September, while Honda’s increased 13.8 percent. But Toyota, Ford and Chrysler all sold fewer vehicles.
snippet: G.M.’s U.S. sales were up 4 percent in September, while Honda’s increased 13.8 percent. But Toyota, Ford and Chrysler all sold fewer vehicles.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Oct. 2 — Its biggest rival, General Motors, has a tentative contract deal with the United Automobile Workers union and relatively stable sales. The Ford Motor Company has neither.

headline.main: A September Sales Drop of 18.2% Ends Dismal 2007 Model Year for Ford
headline.print_headline: A September Sales Drop of 18.2% Ends Dismal 2007 Model Year for Ford
